Description: Bronze lamp: elongated carinated body, somewhat asymmetric, tapering to a flaring nozzle-end, with a circular dished area round the circular wick-hole. Raised rim round the filling-hole, with hinge-pieces at the rear holding a scallop-shell-shaped lamp-lid. Ring-handle with a small thumb-stub at the rear, above which is a handle-ornament in the form of a large crucifix. The lamp stands on a raised circular base, flat below, with a socket for the spike of a lampstand in its centre. The sleeve of the socket, of tapering angular shape, rises inside the oil-chamber. Surface colouration: patchy green, with large areas of iron staining, and lumps of iron corrosion.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (3801)
Xanthopoulou 2010 / Les lampes en bronze à l’époque paléochrétienne (LA 3.056)
